DataElement.preferredName: Hyperthermia Treatment Procedure Stop Other Reason Text
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Text description of an alternate or 'other' reason for the complete termination of a hyperthermia treatment.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Complete cessation of a hyperthermia treatment procedure.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A condition that manifests with abnormally high body temperature. In hyperthermic state, the hypothalamic set-point is normal but body temperature increases and overrides the ability to lose heat, resulting from exogenous heat exposure or endogenous heat production, e.g. in heat stroke, malignant hyperthermia, endocrine hyperthermia, or neuroleptic malignant syndrome. The concept does not refer to hyperpyrexia, the state when the hypothalamic set-point is reset at a higher temperature and is physiologically regulated.

Concepts.definition: A condition characterized by an abnormally high body temperature. In a hyperthermic state, the hypothalamic set-point is normal but body temperature increases and overrides the ability to lose heat, resulting from exogenous heat exposure or endogenous heat production.

Property.preferredDefinition: An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process.:No Value Exists

Concepts.definition: An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter or stop a pathologic process.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: actions or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process (NCI).

ValueDomain.preferredName: Hyperthermia Treatment Stop Other Reason Text
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Text explanation for an alternate or 'other' reason for the termination of a hyperthermia treatment procedure.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: actions or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process (NCI).

RepresentationTerm.preferredName: Hyperthermia Treatment End Other Reason Text
RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: (hye-per-THER-mee-a) A type of treatment in which body tissue is exposed to high temperatures to damage and kill cancer cells or to make cancer cells more sensitive to the effects of radiation and certain anticancer drugs.:The point or place at which something terminates in time, space, or extent.:Not otherwise specified.:An explanation of the cause of some phenomenon or action.:Text; the words of something written.

Concepts.definition: A type of treatment in which body tissue is exposed to high temperatures to damage and kill cancer cells or to make cancer cells more sensitive to the effects of radiation and certain anticancer drugs.
The point or place at which something terminates in time, space, or extent.
Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.
An explanation of the cause of some phenomenon or action.

DataElement.changeDescription: Curated to support Duke University adoption of C3D for ThermoDox trial.
